content.description: This problem has a bit of it all.  It starts with pockets then moves to an arete followed by a crimp and finally a mantle over the top.
content.protection: Like the other problems on this boulder, the sand is most likely good enough protection.
content.location: On the same large boulder in the bottom of the wash as the baconator.

content.description: This is a fun little problem.  It starts on a side pull and a palm off.  The crux is committing to the move to the top.
content.protection: There is a pretty sandy landing and the route is easy enough that a crash pad is probably not necessary.
content.location: This route starts in the middle of the largest boulder in the wash.

content.description: This is a really fun problem that ends up being a little more interesting than it looks.  The sandstone pockets are awesome.
content.protection: There isn't much sand below this one but it isn't to hard.
content.location: This problem is on the bolder just upstream of the boulder which has the baconator.

content.description: This is an easy fun problem that is a little longer than some of the others near by.
content.protection: The sandy wash will catch your falls.
content.location: On the largest boulder in the center of the wash.  This is the far right line on the boulder.
